title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E)
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) 
(Prescription of further age to whom contraceptive services will be made 
available without charge) (Amendment) Regulations 2023. 

(2) The Principal Regulations and these Regulations may be cited together 
as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of further age to whom 
contraceptive services will be made available without charge) Regulations 2022 
to 2023.

heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 September 2023.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 September 2023.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1970
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1970 
(Section 67E) (Prescription of further age to whom contraceptive services will 
be made available without charge) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 675 of 2022).

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: 4. The Schedule to the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting for
text_raw:
4. The Schedule to the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting for 

paragraph 1 the following paragraph: 

“(1) Attained the age of 26 but not yet attained the age of 31.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 August, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd August, 2023.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made under the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No.2) 
Act 2022. 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of 
further age to whom contraceptive services will be made available without 
charge) Regulations 2022. 

These Regulations provide for the extension of the free contraception scheme to 
women up to and including those aged 30. 

These Regulations and the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of 
further age to whom contraceptive services will be made available without 
charge) Regulations 2022 may be cited together as the Health Act 1970 (Section 
67E) (Prescription of further age to whom contraceptive services will be made 
available without charge) Regulations 2022 to 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [408]
